name: Avoid disabling authentication mode messages when using MSMQ transport security
description: The rule will raise a violation when msmqAuthentication mode is set to none(disabled)
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: Without authentication enabled, malicious messages can be sent to queue for processing with the intent to attack.
remediation: Either 'certificate' or 'WindowsDomain' binding must be used to enable authentication
alternativeName: Avoid disabling authentication mode messages when using MSMQ transport security

technicalCriteria.name: OWASP-2013-A2 Broken Authentication and Session Management
OWASP-2013-A7 Missing Function Level Access Control

qualityStandards.name: Improper Authorization
qualityStandards.description: The software does not perform or incorrectly performs an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.

qualityStandards.name: Broken Authentication and Session Management
qualityStandards.description: Application functions related to authentication and session management are often not implemented correctly, allowing attackers to compromise passwords, keys, or session tokens, or to exploit other implementation flaws to assume other users' identities.

qualityStandards.name: Broken Authentication
qualityStandards.description: Application functions related to authentication and session management are often implemented incorrectly, allowing attackers to compromise passwords, keys, or session tokens, or to exploit other implementation flaws to assume other users' identities temporarily or permanently.

qualityStandards.name: Missing Function Level Access Control
qualityStandards.description: Most web applications verify function level access rights before making that functionality visible in the UI. However, applications need to perform the same access control checks on the server when each function is accessed. If requests are not verified, attackers will be able to forge requests in order to access functionality without proper authorization.
